case_title: COLLECTOR OF CUSTOMS vs Haji SAEED AHMED and 2 others
complaint_summary: Smuggled/non-duty paid LED/LCD TVs and refrigerators were intercepted during transportation from Karachi to Hyderabad. Goods were disguised using refrigerators and fake receipts.
investigation_summary: Anti-Smuggling Organization intercepted a Mazda vehicle carrying foreign-origin goods near the Super Highway Toll Plaza, Karachi. Verification revealed discrepancies in receipts and origin claims. Orient Electronics confirmed goods were not locally manufactured.
judgment_summary: The court dismissed the appeal due to procedural deficiencies, including lack of authorization for filing by the Assistant Collector. Some goods were identified as locally manufactured and released, while foreign-origin goods were confiscated. Penalties were imposed on the respondents.
punishment: Confiscation of foreign-origin goods outright. Penalty of Rs. 25,000 imposed on Haji Saeed Ahmed. Vehicle allowed redemption on payment of fine equal to 20% of assessed value and Rs. 10,000 penalty.
Decision_or_verdict: Appeal dismissed in limine due to procedural deficiencies.
legal_arguments: Goods were freely available in the market and presumed duty-paid unless proven otherwise.
Assistant Collector lacked authorization to file appeal under Section 194A of Customs Act, 1969.
Verification by Orient Electronics confirmed foreign origin of goods.
Receipts provided by respondents were manipulated and fake.
sections: Section 3(1) of Imports and Exports Control Act, 1950

witness_statement.Farhan Khan: Present during vehicle search; confirmed foreign-origin goods.
witness_statement.Muhammad Danish: Present during vehicle search; confirmed foreign-origin goods.

key_issues: Burden of proof for legal importation.

maxims.Expressum facit cessare taciturn: When the Legislature requires the doing of a thing in a particular manner, it must be done in that manner.

legal_terms.Confiscation: Seizure of goods by legal authority.
legal_terms.Authorization: Legal permission to act on behalf of an entity.

words_and_phrases.Non-duty paid: Goods for which import duties have not been paid.

summary_vector_notes: The case revolves around smuggling allegations against Haji Saeed Ahmed and Noor Muhammad. Foreign-origin goods were intercepted during transportation near the Super Highway Toll Plaza, Karachi. Procedural deficiencies in filing the appeal led to its dismissal. Some goods were released as locally manufactured, while others were confiscated outright. Penalties were imposed on the respondents.

facts.seizure_location: Super Highway near Toll Plaza, Karachi

violations: Section 3(1) of Imports and Exports Control Act, 1950

key_findings: Part of the goods showed foreign origin (Thailand, Malaysia), while others did not indicate manufacturing origin.
Samsung LED/LCD TVs are locally manufactured by Messrs Orient Electronics in Pakistan.
Burden of proof lies on respondents for goods with foreign origin markings.
orders: Goods with foreign origin markings confiscated outright.
Penalty of Rs.25,000 imposed on respondent.
Vehicle allowed to be redeemed on payment of fine equal to 20% of assessed value.
Penalty of Rs.10,000 imposed on vehicle owner.

appeal_outcome: Appeal dismissed in limine due to lack of valid authorization under Section 194A(2) of Customs Act, 1969.
